channel.title: How to Check if Bridges Work in Whonix Gateway CLI?
channel.description: Hello! I am currently using a hybrid Whonix Gateway CLI and Whonix Workstation GUI setup. I have manually entered my bridges into the /torrc.d/50_user.conf file with all of the necessary syntax according to the Whonix wiki. But I just wanted to know, how could I double check in order to ensure that it's working? It connects to tor successfully but I have no idea how to ensure that it's doing so with the bridges I put in. Thank you!

item.title: How to Check if Bridges Work in Whonix Gateway CLI?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix – 23 Feb 22

Control and Monitor Tor

Using a Tor Controller with Whonix ™. Onion Circuits. Nyx. Vidalia. View or change your Tor circuits. Monitor Tor and inspect logs.

Read full topic
item.source: How to Check if Bridges Work in Whonix Gateway CLI?

item.title: How to Check if Bridges Work in Whonix Gateway CLI?
item.dc:creator: workinandplayin
item.description:
Hello! I am currently using a hybrid Whonix Gateway CLI and Whonix Workstation GUI setup. I have manually entered my bridges into the /torrc.d/50_user.conf file with all of the necessary syntax according to the Whonix wiki. But I just wanted to know, how could I double check in order to ensure that it’s working? It connects to tor successfully but I have no idea how to ensure that it’s doing so with the bridges I put in. Thank you!
